name: Address
comment: Contains values for geographical location, postal address, and  electronic address. Physical address and electronic address are identified by using the Address Type and  Sub Type attributes.
vf short description: Contains values for geographical location, postal address, and  electronic address. Physical address and electronic address are identified by using the Address Type and  Sub Type attributes.

fields.name: AddressSK
fields.comment: Surrogate key of the object

fields.name: ValidFromDate
fields.comment: BI field which represents record validity begin in EDWH

fields.name: ValidUntilDate
fields.comment: BI field which represents record validity end in EDWH

fields.name: KeyTypeId
fields.comment: Key type of record

fields.name: AddressKey
fields.comment: Unique identifier of the address in ALDM. Each address key value represents a unique address. Generated Key based on Address Id, Sub Address Id and Address Source Ind

fields.name: AddressLine1
fields.comment: Line 1 of address which includes details such as streetnumber, street name, office, building, orsuite number. //Customized per implementation. Can be combination of address + sub address attributes.

fields.name: AddressLine2
fields.comment: Line 2 of address which typically includes office, building, or suite number. //Customized per implementation. Can be combination of address + sub address attributes.

fields.name: AddressLine3
fields.comment: Address line 3, which typically contains the town and the city. //Customized per implementation. Can be combination of address + sub address attributes.

fields.name: AddressLine4
fields.comment: Address line 4, which typically contains the province and the country. //Customized per implementation. Can be combination of address + sub address attributes.

fields.name: CitySK
fields.comment: Surrogate key of the object

fields.name: StateSK
fields.comment: Surrogate key of the object

fields.name: CountrySK
fields.comment: Surrogate key of the object

fields.name: ZipCodeSK
fields.comment: Surrogate key of the object

fields.name: ElectronicAddress
fields.comment: Specifies the full electronic address of the subscriber. For example, phonenumber including the country code (if needed) and the area code, e-mail Id, pager number.

fields.name: PostalStreetName
fields.comment: Indicates the street name for a postal address. GeographicAddress.streetName

fields.name: PostalStreetNumber
fields.comment: Indicates the street number for a postal address. GeographicAddress.streetNr

fields.name: PostalTown
fields.comment: Indicates the postal address of a town.

fields.name: AddressId
fields.comment: Unique identifier of the address in the source system. GeographicAddress.id

fields.name: FloorNum
fields.comment: Specifies the floor or unit number for the address.

fields.name: AddressTypeSK
fields.comment: Surrogate key of the object

fields.name: PoBoxCode
fields.comment: Post office box code number.

fields.name: AddressValidationInd
fields.comment: Specifies whether the address has been validated either from an address from the Address Validation system, or manually. Values are:- 0= Not validated- 1=Validated from the system- 2=Validated by the userDefaults to 0. If Address Source Ind = GA then GeographicAddress.statusIf Address Source Ind = GSA then GeographicSubAddress.status

fields.name: PhysicalAddressFlag
fields.comment: Indicates whether the address is physical.Values are:- 0=Not Physical- 1=Physical

fields.name: PostalAddressFlag
fields.comment: Indicates whether the address is a postal address.Values are:- 1 - Postal address- 0 - Not a postal address

fields.name: AddressSourceInd
fields.comment: Indicates whether the address is physical or electronic. Values are:P = Physical address, E = Electronic address, For D1: Indicates if address is just a high level address or a detailed address.GA: Geographic Address (High Level), GSA: Geographic Sub Address (Detailed Address) If source is just GeographicAddress then GA . If source is combination(join) of GeographicAddress and GeographicSubAddress then GSA .

fields.name: ElectronicAddressSubTypeInd
fields.comment: Specifies the subtype of the electronic address. For example, if the electronic address is e-mail, then the subtypes can be SMTP, Microsoft, Lotus Notes, Internet, and so on. This is a user defined pop-up.

fields.name: BssModificationDate
fields.comment: Indicates the date on which a record was modified in the source system GeographicAddress.lastModifiedOn

fields.name: ApartmentNum
fields.comment: Apartment name or number in a postal address.

fields.name: ElectronicAccessNum
fields.comment: Stores additional number needed to complete an address after the initial connection is made. For example, voice mail box number, telephone extension number, and so on.

fields.name: Geocode
fields.comment: Geocode associated to address GeographicAddress.geographicLocation.spatialRef

fields.name: County
fields.comment: County of address

fields.name: PostalStreetNumberLast
fields.comment: The last number in a range of street numbers allocated to a property. GeographicAddress.streetNrLast

fields.name: PostalStreetNumberSuffix
fields.comment: The first street number suffix. GeographicAddress.streetNrSuffix

fields.name: PostalStreetNumberLastSuffix
fields.comment: The last street number suffix for a ranged address. GeographicAddress.streetNrLastSuffix

fields.name: StreetType
fields.comment: The type of street. Alley, avenue, boulevard, brae, crescent, drive, highway, lane, terrace, parade, place, tarn, way, or wharf GeographicAddress.streetType

fields.name: StreetSuffix
fields.comment: A modifier denoting a particular direction. GeographicAddress.streetSuffix

fields.name: AddressDisplayText
fields.comment: The display text for the address. For example in case of @type=Country the displayText would contain long displayble string. GeographicAddress.displayText

fields.name: Locality
fields.comment: An area of defined or undefined boundaries within a local authority or other legislatively defined area, usually rural or semi-rural in nature GeographicAddress.locality

fields.name: BssCreationDate
fields.comment: Date and Time when the address was created. GeographicAddress.createdOn

fields.name: SubAddressId
fields.comment: Identifier for a GeographicSubAddress GeographicSubAddress.id

fields.name: SubAddressName
fields.comment: Name of geographicSubAddress to identify it with a meaningful identification GeographicSubAddress.name

fields.name: SubAddressType
fields.comment: Type of sub-address. Can be sub-unit or private street GeographicSubAddress.subAddressType

fields.name: SubUnitType
fields.comment: The type of subunit e.g. BERTH, FLAT, PIER, SUITE, SHOP, TOWER, UNIT, WHARF GeographicSubAddress.subUnitType

fields.name: SubUnitNumber
fields.comment: The discrimator used for the subunit often just a simple number e.g. FLAT No, may also be a range. GeographicSubAddress.subUnitNumber

fields.name: SubAddressLevelType
fields.comment: This describes the level types within a building. GeographicSubAddress.levelType

fields.name: SubAddressLevelNumber
fields.comment: This is used where a level type may be repeated. GeographicSubAddress.levelNumber

fields.name: BuildingName
fields.comment: This allows for buildings that have well-known names. GeographicSubAddress.buildingName

fields.name: PrivateStreetNumber
fields.comment: A private street number internal to a private street. GeographicSubAddress.privateStreetNumber

fields.name: PrivateStreetName
fields.comment: Private streets internal to a property may have internal names. GeographicSubAddress.privateStreetName

fields.name: AddressTypeInd
fields.comment: Identifies the address type. If Address Source Ind = GA then GeographicAddress.@typeIf Address Source Ind = GSA then GeographicSubAddress.@type

fields.name: SourceSystemId
fields.comment: Represents the code of the source system that the leading entity of the current target is coming from. It is suffix also include the code of the DB instance on that system such that in case of multiple instances of the same source system are deployed (Scalability) it will be possible to trace the target to it is source system instance

fields.name: DeleteIndicator
fields.comment: Set to True when the leading source entity of this target entity was deleted in the source system

fields.name: Insert_Load_Id
fields.comment: BI technical field for job id which inserted the record in the table

fields.name: Update_Load_Id
fields.comment: BI technical field for job id which updated the record in the table
